citeinfo.origin: USDA Forest Service - Pacific Southwest Region - Remote Sensing Lab
citeinfo.title: PlotLocations.DBO.MasterHexNonHex2012_FUZZ_Update13Nov19

descript.abstract: This point layer consists of Forest Inventory Analysis (FIA) (hex/grid) plots and "intensification" (non-hex/off-grid) plots for rare forest types and plantations that have been "fuzzed" (offset) by a maximum distance of 1 mile from the original location.11/2013 (dbeardsley, cclark):Table received from PNW with latitude, longitude coords (LAT_FUZZ, LON_FUZZ fields) in WGS84 Datum. Point layer created from coordinates and projected to Teale Albers, NAD 83. HEX_NONHEX field: "Hex" = FIA plot, "NonHex" = Intensification plot
descript.purpose: The actual locations of FIA plots are protected by federal statute. Disclosure of the actual locations of these plots is prohibited without certain legal protections (such as a Memorandum of Understanding - MOU). Plot coordinates are confidential for 4 reasons: 1) protect the identity of the individual landowner 2) prevent the landowner from visits by non-FIA field crews 3) protect the integrity of the plot 4) ensure the validity of the sampling scheme The so-called offgrid NFS plots are technically not covered by the same federal statute, and while the landowner in this case is publically known, the reasons for protecting these coordinates are just as valid. Unsupervised visits to plots result in trampling, destructive sampling, or otherwise biasing the sample. By agreement of all FIA Units, actual coordinates are 'fuzzed' (or offset) a random distance. 95% of coordinates are fuzzed up to a distance of ½ mile, and the remaining 5% of plots are fuzzed up to a maximum distance of 1 mile. Fuzzed coordinates are evaluated (and modified if necessary) to remain in the same county and Forest as the actual location. This is useful for both analysis and display.
descript.supplinf:
.
12/2009 (cclark, GD) Fuzzed coordinates, developed by the Pacific Northwest Research Station (PNW), received and used to create feature class.
.

idinfo.useconst: Not recommended for use at scales greater than 1:24000

cntperp.cntorg: Forest Inventory and Analysis - PNW Research Station

cntinfo.cntinst: Office is closed on federal holidays

secinfo.sechandl: Public: These fuzzed coordinates should be used for all public access to plot data. NFS employees: There is an existing MOU that allows NFS employees access to accurate plot coordinates for all plots on NFS lands. However, any printed or electronic material that is distributed outside the FS should use the fuzzed coordinates. For instance, any map showing plot locations should use fuzzed coordinates if distributed outside the FS.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

procstep.procdesc:
PROCESS TO CREATE FUZZED COORDINATES FOR OFFGRID (NON-HEX) PLOTS:
Coordinates were fuzzed using RAND(), SIN(), COS() and PI() functions in Excel. 95% of coordinates were fuzzed to a max distance of ½ mile (804.672 meters), and the remaining 5% of plots were fuzzed to a maximum distance of 1 mile (1609.344 meters). A displacement angle was determined using a random variant (range = 1-360 degrees), and the X and Y offset distances were determined using trigonometry.
The pseudo code for this operation (using Excel functions) is: Assign 4 random numbers (range = 0 to 1) RAND1 = RAND() - used to determine maximum fuzzing distance for the plot (1/2 or 1 mile) RAND2 = RAND() - used to determine angle of offset (based on 360 degrees) RAND3 = RAND() - used to determine actual x offset RAND4 = RAND() - used to determine actual y offset IF RAND1 < 0.95 MAXOFFSET = 804.672 (1/2 mile) ELSE MAXOFFSET = 1609.344 (1 mile) ANGLE = RAND2 * 360 X_OFFSET = MAXOFFSET * RAND3 * SIN(ANGLE * PI()/180) Y_OFFSET = MAXOFFSET * RAND4 * COS(ANGLE * PI()/180) FUZZED_X = ACTUAL_X + X_OFFSET (actual coords in UTM) FUZZED_Y = ACTUAL_Y + Y_OFFSET (actual coords in UTM)
SOURCE DATA The 'actual' coordinates used for this process were received from a view provided by Ron Wanek on October 20, 2009: CAP_R5_OFFGRID_DATA_ALL_V (2591 records)
Fields used were Utm_x_z10_n27 Utm_y_z10_n27
MAINTENANCE There are two cases where the fuzzed coordinates may need to be changed over time. 1) As plots are field visited and new GPS coordinates are collected, the fuzzed coordinates might need to be edited if the new actual coordinate is different enough to no longer be within the 1 mile fuzzing limit. 2) If land exchanges or Forest boundaries change, the fuzzed coordinate may need to be edited so that it falls within the correct Forest boundary. Requests to change fuzzed coordinates should be forwarded to PNW FIA Portland Office. This will ensure that the new fuzzed coordinates are updated in all relevant databases. Changes to fuzzed coordinates are rare, and are usually made using ocular (on-screen) techniques on a case by case basis.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
PROCESS TO CREATE FUZZED COORDINATES FOR FIAGRID (HEX) PLOTS:
Go to http://www.fia.fs.fed.us/tools-data/docs/default.asp and see http://www.fia.fs.fed.us/tools-data/docs/pdfs/draft%20FIADB_user%20guide_v4-0_p2_05_27_09_pdf.pdf

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypds: For a description of this dataset and a listing of valid values, go to the Remote Sensing Lab Forest Resource Database Dictionary (FRDB) at http://www.fs.usda.gov/detailfull/r5/landmanagement/resourcemanagement/?cid=stelprdb5386545&width=full

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.distliab: This product is reproduced from geospatial information prepared by the U.S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service. By removing the contents of this package or taking receipt of these files via electronic file transfer methods, you understand that the data stored on this media is in draft condition. Represented features may not be in an accurate geographic location. The Forest Service makes no expressed or implied warranty, including warranty of merchantability and fitness, with respect to the character, function, or capabilities of the data or their appropriateness for any user's purposes. The Forest Service reserves the right to correct, update, modify, or replace this geospatial information without notification. For more information, contact the Remote Sensing Lab, 916-640-1256.

dataIdInfo.idPurp: The actual locations of FIA plots are protected by federal statute. Disclosure of the actual locations of these plots is prohibited without certain legal protections (such as a Memorandum of Understanding - MOU). Plot coordinates are confidential for 4 reasons: 1) protect the identity of the individual landowner 2) prevent the landowner from visits by non-FIA field crews 3) protect the integrity of the plot 4) ensure the validity of the sampling scheme The so-called offgrid NFS plots are technically not covered by the same federal statute, and while the landowner in this case is publically known, the reasons for protecting these coordinates are just as valid. Unsupervised visits to plots result in trampling, destructive sampling, or otherwise biasing the sample. By agreement of all FIA Units, actual coordinates are 'fuzzed' (or offset) a random distance. 95% of coordinates are fuzzed up to a distance of ½ mile, and the remaining 5% of plots are fuzzed up to a maximum distance of 1 mile. Fuzzed coordinates are evaluated (and modified if necessary) to remain in the same county and Forest as the actual location. This is useful for both analysis and display.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This point layer consists of Forest Inventory Analysis (FIA) (hex/grid) plots and "intensification" (non-hex/off-grid) plots for rare forest types and plantations that have been "fuzzed" (offset) by a maximum distance of 1 mile from the original location.

MasterHexNonHex2014_FUZZ_Upd2015July7

7/2015 (dbeardsley, cclark):

We cannot get FUZZ coordinates from PNW anymore. So Deb used the 2013 FUZZ feature class and added the two new HEX plots using the fuzzed coordinates which are in the FIADB 2013 database on-line.

Carol updated ELEV with the actual elevation numbers generated (by Tanya) from DEM process on MasterHEX2014 and MasternonHEX2014.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

11/2013 (dbeardsley, cclark):

Table received from PNW with latitude, longitude coords (LAT_FUZZ, LON_FUZZ fields) in WGS84 Datum. Point layer created from coordinates and projected to Teale Albers, NAD 83.

HEX_NONHEX field: "Hex" = FIA plot, "NonHex" = Intensification plot

Consts.useLimit: Not recommended for use at scales greater than 1:24000
